title: 109_s1039
content: The Gas Price Reduction Through Increased Refinery Capacity Act of 2005, also known as the ``Gas Price Reduction Through Increased Refinery Capacity Act of 2005'', provides incentives for investment in oil refineries through an election to expense certain refineries under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Gas Price Reduction Through Increased Refinery Capacity Act of 2005 allows taxpayers to elect to treat the cost of qualified refinery property as an expense, deductible in the year the refinery is placed in service. The election must be made on the tax return and is irrevocable without the Secretary's consent. Qualified refinery property includes any refinery or portion under construction. The Gas Price Reduction Through Increased Refinery Capacity Act of 2005 allows taxpayers to treat the cost of qualified refinery property as an expense if certain conditions are met, including being placed in service before January 1, 2012, increasing the refinery's capacity by 5% or more, and meeting all applicable environmental laws. The Gas Price Reduction Through Increased Refinery Capacity Act of 2005 allows taxpayers to expense qualified refinery property if certain conditions are met, such as increasing capacity by 5% before January 1, 2012, and complying with environmental laws. The property must not be used for specific purposes like topping plants or blending facilities, and must not be built solely for federal projects or consent decrees. The Gas Price Reduction Through Increased Refinery Capacity Act of 2005 allows taxpayers to expense qualified refinery property if certain conditions are met, such as increasing capacity by 5% before January 1, 2012, and complying with environmental laws. 1986 is amended by inserting a new item after section 179B. The Gas Price Reduction Through Increased Refinery Capacity Act of 2005 allows taxpayers to expense qualified refinery property if certain conditions are met, such as increasing capacity by 5% before January 1, 2012, and complying with environmental laws. Section 179C allows for the election to expense certain refineries, including petroleum refining property. The Gas Price Reduction Through Increased Refinery Capacity Act of 2005 allows taxpayers to expense qualified refinery property if capacity is increased by 5% before January 1, 2012, and environmental laws are complied with. The term "asset" excludes assets not meeting environmental laws, assets for which a deduction was taken by another taxpayer in a previous year, and waivers under the Clean Air Act. The Gas Price Reduction Through Increased Refinery Capacity Act of 2005 allows taxpayers to expense qualified refinery property for refineries placed in service after the enactment date, except for those under a binding construction contract before that date.
